Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)- Richmond (3 clients available)
Job Description:
Step Ahead ABA strongly believes that BCBA’s (and RBT’s, for that matter) deserve:

the support they need to provide quality care without burning themselves out,
leadership they trust to operate ethically and in the best interest of clients and staff,
trust from supervisors to do their job without micromanagement,
mentorship opportunities to build their skills,

and (quite importantly)

compensation that reflects the importance of the work they do.

Our clinical team is growing and we’re looking for talented, driven Board Certified Behavior Analysts ready for a change and a team member centered culture. We provide home and community-based services to autistic individuals and their families and are dedicated to ensuring small caseloads to focus your skills where it’s needed most. Our dedicated administrative team works to minimize busy work for our clinicians and do a great job at it!

Why Work for Us?:

“Full-time” caseloads designed around ~25 client hours per week
Join our well-rounded team (1-10+ years of experience in the field)
Meet regularly with colleagues to share knowledge, insights, and grow clinical skills as a team!
Full autonomy over your schedule and cases with the support when and where you need it
A company committed to it’s values

What We Offer:

Full-time and part-time positions available!
Relocation assistance—let us help you join our team!
Flexible compensation packages—$100/client hour (uncapped earning potential and no minimum billings!)
Ongoing clinical support from a BCBA Regional Director and mentorship opportunities for new BCBA’s and students working towards certification
A great place to work that’ll respect your time… when you’re not at work!

Qualifications:

A valid Board Certified Behavior Analyst certification OR intent to sit for board exams within next 3 months
Clinical experience with Autism Spectrum Disorders and other developmental disorders
Cultural humility and responsiveness
Spanish speaking bilingual a plus!
Responsibilities:

- Conduct assessments and develop individualized treatment plans for individuals with autism and other developmental disabilities
- Implement evidence-based behavioral interventions and strategies
- Provide direct behavior analytic services to clients, including behavioral therapy and skill acquisition training
- Collect and analyze data to monitor progress and make data-driven decisions
- Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals to ensure consistency and generalization of skills across settings
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of client progress, treatment plans, and medical records
- Stay current with research and best practices in the field of applied behavior analysis (ABA)
- Adhere to ethical guidelines and maintain confidentiality in accordance with HIPAA regulations

Requirements:
- Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification
- Experience working with individuals with autism or developmental disabilities
- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques
- Familiarity with behavioral health practices and interventions
- Understanding of special education laws and regulations
- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, families, and multidisciplinary teams
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Proficient in data collection, analysis, and report writing

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:

-Assists in managing clinical operations of Bloomington IN location

-Requires hands-on training with students studying Applied Behavior Analysis

-Small case load (6-8) with early intervention (patient age range 2-4)

- Conduct assessments and develop individualized treatment plans for children with autism and other developmental disabilities

- Provide one-on-one consultation to clients, therapists, and all stakeholders based on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

- Implement behavior intervention strategies to address challenging behaviors and promote skill development

- Collect and analyze data to track progress and make data-driven decisions regarding treatment plans

- Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, including parents, caregivers, and other professionals, to ensure coordinated care

- Provide training and support to parents and caregivers on implementing behavior management strategies at home

- Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification required

-Expert in communication of Behavior Intervention Plan strategies to external stakeholders

-Proficient in Data Analysis, Data Collection and Systems management

- Extensive experience working with children with Autism and/or Developmental disabilities

- Proficient knowledge of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) principles and techniques

- Strong data collection and analysis skills

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team

-Ability to lead large groups towards common goal

This role requires a strong commitment to making a positive impact on the lives of children with special needs and all those involved. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative and supportive environment, manage teams, further their training, education, and certification with other experts in the field, and ultimately make a difference in the lives of individuals and families that is long lasting.

Please note that this is a full-time position with competitive compensation and allows for flexible schedule and frequent access to professional development opportunities

Minimum of five years of experience in data analytics or database management required.

Reports to the Director of Business Intelligence. Plays a role in shaping Beacon's data infrastructure, inclusive of data-warehousing, reporting, and analytics platforms. Using logical approaches and sound methodologies, mines data in search of innovative business insights and communicates findings to the relevant stakeholders. This includes building statistical models, diagnosing, validating, and improving the performance of these models over time in addition to creating efficient and reusable processes meant for the improvement, manipulation, and analysis of data. Additionally the Sr. Data Analyst leads data projects from requirements gathering to project implementation, identifying and communicating risks and issues along the way to ensure successful project delivery. This analytical role develops KPIs and other reporting mechanisms within Beacon for the purpose of identifying trends and evaluating the success of the Beacon's initiatives.

Supports Beacon's strategic growth decisions across the organization by:

Providing market research reporting, analyzing data and delivering actionable data in a timely manner for Beacon Health System.
Identifies, evaluates, and documents potential data sources in support of project requirements within the assigned departments within Beacon.
Preparing market reports to support new business plans and expansion opportunities.
Ensuring processes developed are reliable, repeatable, scalable, and documented.
Providing actionable insight into current market trends to drive decisions on Beacon's strategic positioning.
Supports and executes change management activities with regard to data analysis across Beacon.
Utilizes data to guide assigned business departments through all programs and initiatives, enabling continuous improvement in data quality, departmental performance, and overall business performance.

Makes positive contributes towards developing an organizational culture at Beacon Health System that uses data to make better decisions by:

Provides accurate and effective communication between technical and business teams.
Connects the use of data with business processes and identifies opportunities to innovate. Leads conversations with end-users to identify innovation opportunities.
Validates innovation ideas by developing proof-of-concepts to test idea feasibility.
Develops models and ad hoc reports, sharing observations and recommendations with senior management, executives, and stakeholders for further consideration.

Supports the development and maintenance of a system-wide data analytics platform and function by:

Develop a deep understanding of data structures and business knowledge to ensure veracity of the data presented in BI platform. Document existing processes and propose improvements to support an accessible, accurate, and scalable BI platform. Develop, execute, and document best practices associated to extracting data from BI landscape to educate end users.
Demonstrate a strong customer focus and collaborative relationship with end users. Develop and propose innovative approaches for making data driven decisions. Support end user training by developing training materials and facilitating individual and group training sessions.

Education and Experience

The knowledge, skills and abilities as indicated below are normally acquired through the successful completion of a Bachelor's Degree in Data Analytics, Informatics, Database Management, Business, Economics, or a related field.
Master's degree in business preferred.
A minimum of five years of experience in data analytics or database management, preferably in a healthcare setting, is required.

Knowledge & Skills

Requires strong analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Requires a strong background in financial analysis and using data to support decision-making.
Requires an in-depth technical expertise regarding data models, database design development,
Requires excellent interpersonal skills, able to deal effectively with diverse skill sets and personalities, provide strong team leadership, and work effectively as a team player.
Excellent oral, written and presentation skills.

Job Title: IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst
Job Description:
Labcorp is a leading global life sciences company that provides comprehensive diagnostic and drug development services to patients, physicians, and healthcare organizations. Our mission is to improve health and improve lives by delivering world-class diagnostic solutions, drug development services, and technologies to advance medicine and improve patient care.
IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst

Labcorp IT seeks an experienced IT professional for the role of IT Sr Technical Specialist, Analytics Analyst. will be part of a newly formed division supporting laboratory partnerships and acquisitions and will collaborate with IT, vendor, business, laboratory operations, and partnership stakeholders to ensure successful LIS implementations. The IT Sr Technical Specialist will demonstrate a working knowledge of the Cerner Millennium Analytics and Lights On Modules, Laboratory operations and the ability to learn complex processes and technology quickly.

Responsibilities:

Serves as a member of the broader LIS implementation team and collaborates in accomplishing defined strategic LIS initiatives for the Health System Operating Division.
Contributes to the development of the overall IT strategy for LIS implementation; develops repeatable implementation processes for assigned laboratory initiatives.
Prepares and leads meetings at an appropriate cadence; uses excellent verbal and written communication.
Partners with operations leaders to identify site-specific requirements that impact the deployment strategy.
Leads current state review and assesses current processes and workflows within the labs for any scope gaps or potential risks or issues.
Leads future state review to demo all workflows.
Assists with decision making and completes the Data Collection Workbooks to capture data for LIS configuration.
Plans and manages the configuration of the solution into the system.
Raises integration points with workstreams where there is crossover with other workstreams.
Applies technical expertise to build design, configuration, and execution.
Documents lessons learned to ensure ongoing success with future initiatives.
Fosters a collaborative environment by establishing a team atmosphere of candor, trust, and mutual respect.
Supports the laboratories through cutover and transition to support.

Education and Qualifications:

A BA (Bachelor of Arts) or BS (Bachelor of Science) degree is required.
5+ years of IT experience including extensive Cerner Millennium Analytics build experience including Data Analytics 2, CCL and Lights On. Implementation experience for multi facility projects is strongly recommended.
Laboratory clinical experience is recommended.
A solid understanding of the Laboratory industry and Laboratory workflows and how the LIS impacts and is impacted by surround technologies to include Revenue Cycle, Electronic Health Records, etc.
Critical thinking skills and the ability to translate abstract information into a consumable format.

When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and join a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of more than $40 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and chances to create significant contributions to the world.

The job:

Discover impactful work as our new Marketing Data Analyst.

The EMEA Life Sciences Marketing organisation delivers more than $400M in revenue every year. You will be joining a fast paced and dynamic Marketing Data & Analytics team focused on driving demand generation through data-driven strategies, robust technology solutions, tracking results, and delivering valuable data insights. We collaborate with various functions including, Sales Operations, Commercial teams, IT and global functions to define strategies, optimise marketing processes, and achieve business goals, revenue growth, and success.

As an experienced Marketing Data Analyst, you will play an important role in both strategic projects and day to day operations of lead management. You will be responsible for executing and supporting marketing performance reporting while ensuring data compliance, health, and flow of marketing customer data. Your expertise will contribute to optimising and automating data management and tracking processes across divisions and functions, driving efficiency, and enhancing customer engagement and experience.

This role is office-based at our Inchinnan, Paisley site (near Glasgow), with the flexibility to work from home one day per week.

What will you do?


Manage marketing customer data:

Ensure compliance, data integrity, and smooth flow of customer data from collection to delivery within the commercial organisation
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure system compatibility and accurate data assignment

Optimise data management and tracking processes:

Find opportunities to improve efficiency and customer engagement by streamlining and automating data management and tracking processes across divisions and functions
Implement best practices to enhance data quality and reliability

Provide data-driven consultancy:

Offer valuable insights and consultancy services to improve marketing and business outcomes across multiple channels and data sources
Collaborate with Data Science teams, support lead generation, cross-divisional campaigns, and sales activation initiatives

Marketing Analytics, Reporting & Insights:

Present actionable insights and recommendations to the marketing organisation, enabling data-driven strategic decision-making to support business growth
Support the development and maintenance of marketing analytics PowerBI dashboards and reports by integrating data from multiple sources

Marketing Technology (MarTech) advancement:

Lead the advancement of MarTech capabilities within the EMEA marketing function, developing and delivering streamlined and scalable business solutions
Translate business needs into marketing/CRM system requirements to ensure alignment with organisational goals

Collaboration and influence:

Collaborate with a complex and dynamic global, regional, and corporate marketing organisation to anticipate, optimise and evolve data strategies, considering complex business requirements and system integrations
Build strong relationships with Sales Operations and Salesforce Excellence teams to maximise the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and improve sales rep compliance, win rates, and rejection rates

Stakeholder communication:

Effectively connect with key stakeholders, including marketing development managers, marketing operations, Sales Operations, IT, and global partners

Project contribution and influence:

Contribute to and influence the planning and execution of large-scale global/regional multi-functional marketing data and analytics projects

Who we are looking for:

Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (Maths, Economics, Computing, Statistics etc.), or equivalent education and experience in database management and analytics are required
Able to translate business data strategy into marketing data strategy and ensure detailed execution of the plan aligned with marketing goals
Analytical mindset and comfortable manipulating large data sets, critical thinking skills and can visualise metrics to clearly communicate key insights
Solid understanding of software applications: Eloqua, Salesforce, PowerBI and Adobe all nice to have
Solid understanding of data sources, data structure and relationships, data organisation and storage and experience with reporting packages (Cognos, SQL)
Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills, experience in dealing with multiple and diverse internal collaborators, and interacting with business and technology partners across all organisational levels
Strong project management and organisational abilities
Ability to prioritise multiple tasks effectively, identify and resolve problems and work with a sense of urgency
Detail-oriented and able to lead complex projects with multiple stakeholders
Proven track record to think creatively, developing new ideas and forward-thinking solutions
Strong verbal and written communication skills along with a customer-focused attitude
Thrives in a fast-paced environment, flexible and ability to adapt quickly to change.

What’s in it for you:

Excellent career progression opportunities with a large and growing global employer
Competitive salary, plus annual incentive bonus
Benefits package including 25 days annual leave, plus public holidays; discounted private healthcare; life assurance; pension – matched employer contributions up to 8%; discounted gym memberships and more

JOB SUMMARY

The Data Analyst partners across the organization to provide direct support on projects and requests that require data, research, analysis and report development for strategic or tactical decision-making. This position plays a key role in building organizational understanding of current landscapes based on data, informs change planning efforts, provides recommendations for operational and experience-based improvements, and helps to drive data-mindedness into team culture.




ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Supports business analytics and research projects and processes to provide data-driven insights used to advise and develop business strategies and initiatives, including contractual obligations with external stakeholders;
Uses statistical methods, modeling, analytical methodologies, and data analysis to develop and deploy tools including reports, visualizations, dashboards, infographics, and models to inform and support decision-making.
Develops and maintains applications and reports for business reporting and analysis purposes, including ad hoc data analysis and special projects.
Visualize data insights via a variety of mediums and formats best suited to the target audience.
Provide direct support and technical assistance to internal stakeholders and statewide partners on the utilization of data tools and reports.
Perform quality checks and validation of data, monitoring data quality, troubleshooting and resolving database issues to ensure data integrity.
Other duties as assigned to advance the mission of Early Learning Indiana.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & REQUIREMENTS

An individual must have the following education and/or experience:

Bachelor’s degree in related or adjacent fields, including, but not limited to, computer sciences, mathematics, financial services, technology
Experience with SPSS, R, or similar and tools such as PowerBI preferred
Experience with ArcGIS a plus



COMPETENCIES & SKILLS

The successful team member will demonstrate individual competency in the following areas:

Strong technical skills and a working knowledge of CRM, listening tools and other survey and data analytics tools
Familiarity with geo-spatial analysis tools and mapping competency
Proven project management, time management and multi-tasking abilities while maintaining excellent attention to detail
Ability to communicate timely, accurate and useful market data to senior leaders, functional leaders, internal and external stakeholders
Ability to provide accurate, insightful and intuitive analysis
Ability to analyze data and identify strategic opportunities from facts
Strong service-oriented communication skills
Able to adapt communication style and approach to varying audiences and stakeholders

WORK CONTEXT

This is a hybrid work position. A successful team member will be expected to work productively:

Work from home 3 out of 5 days per week on average.
Work from the statewide office located at 1411 N. Roosevelt Ave in Indianapolis 2 out of 5 days per week, likely Tuesday and Wednesday but subject to change.
Be able to travel to and from events throughout the state as needed.
The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The team member frequently is required to:
Stand, walk, sit
Use hands and fingers to handle books, paper, technology
Use computer and other electronic equipment and technology
Speak and listen to others
See and read
Reach with hands and arms
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
Legally be eligible to work in the United States.



The statements contained herein describe the scope of the responsibility and essential functions of this position but should not be considered an all-inclusive list of work requirements.

Employment with Early Learning Indiana is contingent upon satisfactorily completing pre-employment requirements. Pre-employment screenings include, but are not limited to: criminal background and drug screenings. Employment with Early Learning Indiana is at-will.




ABOUT EARLY LEARNING INDIANA

Early Learning Indiana is a nonprofit organization on a mission to ensure children are empowered with essential skills to thrive in kindergarten and beyond. We practice what we teach by operating a network of premier, community-based schools – called Day Early Learning centers – where we advance the science of early education, invest in a new generation of teaching, and instill essential skills in over 1,000 children each day. Building on more than a century of experience, Early Learning Indiana also serves as a leading voice and advocate for the transformation of Indiana’s early learning landscape by addressing systemic barriers to access, affordability, and quality. Learn more about us at EarlyLearningIn.org.

Early Learning Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sex, citizenship status, military status, marital status, amnesty, or other status protected by law.

Department



FAMILY MEDICINE (IN-FAMM-IUINA)

Department Information



The Bowen Center for Health Workforce Research and Policy is named in honor of Otis R. Bowen, MD, former Governor of Indiana, Secretary of Health and Human Services for the United States, Chair of the National Governors Association, and committed family medicine physician.

Through collaborations with state and federal agencies, nonprofit organizations, academic partners, health professionals, employers, and community advocates, the Bowen Center contributes to analyzing complex health workforce issues and informing related policy and programming.

Job Summary
Performs data collection, data analysis, data management, literature research, and technical writing in support of research project(s); performs quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis.
Consults with faculty researchers and research staff and provides input on research project evaluations and research project designs.
Writes various technical reports, journal articles, and/or develops presentations to disseminate and share research findings.
Reviews and performs various analyses to ensures quality assurance of research findings (data quality, reports, etc.).
Researches, reviews, and stays up-to-date on related research project reports and/or publications.
Represents the department with regard to related research and participates in professional development activities and programs.
Mentors and/or provides guidance to students, faculty, or other staff working on research project(s) through training in related aspects of research techniques and analysis as needed; may provide daily oversight to less experienced staff or student researchers.
Provides additional research project support as needed.
Qualifications



Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. Education beyond the minimum required may be substituted for work experience. Work experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted for education.


EDUCATION

Required

Master's degree preferably in research-oriented field such as statistics, public health/policy analysis, etc.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

COUNTY OF VANDERBURGH, INDIANA

POSITION: Data Analyst 1 (942301) Pre to 3

JOB CATEGORY: VCHD 8

DEPARTMENT: Vanderburgh County Health Department - Administration

SUPERVISOR: Supervisor of Data

DATE WRITTEN: 1990 DATE REVISED: July 2023

Summary:

The Vanderburgh County Health Department’s mission is to build a healthier Vanderburgh County so everyone in Vanderburgh County can live their healthiest life. Vanderburgh County Health Department is offering an outstanding opportunity as a Public Health Data Analyst I.Come join our dedicated and mission-driven team, and you will enjoy excellent benefits and work/life programs, a superior retirement package, and the chance to see how your work directly improves the health of your community. The Vanderburgh County Health Department has achieved Public Health Accreditation Board (PHAB) accreditation, distinguishing it as a top health department, and prides itself on providing a diverse and inclusive work environment with opportunities to grow and develop professionally. Be part of a team that exists to serve our clients and community by working with community partners to develop and provide quality health care services, promote healthy lifestyles, protect against and prevent the spread of disease, and assure preparedness to achieve and maintain the best public health for our community.

Location:

Vanderburgh County Health Department with potential travel to surrounding counties

Definition:

The Public Health Data Analyst I will help collect, analyze, query, report, and visualize data from a variety of different domains, and use the data to improve the health of the community. The Public Health Data Analyst I will conduct full lifecycle analyses to include requirements, activities and design along with monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify opportunities for improvement that align with Vanderburgh County Health Department’s mission and vision.

Duties:

Data Quality: Ensures datasets are accurate and clean by doing initial scrubbing of data and regular scheduled examination of records. Tracks and reports progress on data cleaning goals. Formulates techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy, and legitimacy of data. Acquires data from primary and secondary sources including other Vanderburgh County Health Department divisions and employees, community partners, and Indiana Department of Health contacts in order to maintain databases/data systems. Deviation from the normal operating methods are discussed with supervisor and Health Department leadership as needed. Maintains data quality through ongoing data analysis, case detail and sub-details, and record deduplication. Implements process improvements that contribute to improved data quality. Plans the development, mining, and modification of data from multiple sources, ensuring compliance with policies and procedures for agency, state, and federal programs. Holds administrative responsibility and oversight of data systems, reporting and information systems, and other third-party systems as assigned.
Data/Statistical Analysis: Extracts clean data from systems of record. Reviews, analyzes, and finalizes data that must be provided for reports in accordance with federal guidance and relevant detail sheets indicating definition and data source. Analyzes specific data sets and works closely with data stewards to ensure accuracy and completeness of data; follows up with data stewards and/or internal or external partners including vendors to correct or complete data. Identifies, analyzes, interprets, summarizes, and documents trends or patterns within the data sets and develops recommendations for program improvements and/or new initiatives. Develop programs for providing more effective public health initiatives, as well as resolve current service issues. Completes necessary trainings to increase skill in manipulating and formatting data in a way that is readily consumed. Read technical literature and participate in continuing education or professional association to maintain awareness of current database technology and best practices. Identifies other data needed to effectively evaluate activities and progress related to the action plan priorities, objectives, and measures. Performs qualitative and/or quantitative analysis, develops and analyzes statistical information.
Reporting: Maintains and refines reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity. Works with management to identify new and creative opportunities to leverage shared data to support additional program improvement processes or functions. Completes necessary trainings to manipulate and format data as needed. Develops initial drafts of each report per specifications; provides drafts to leadership team for review and input prior to delivery; incorporates feedback received including modifications to processes and procedures. Develops analytic and reporting requirements from grant details and leadership team. Reports performance to internal partners. Creates tools to provide internal leadership with real-time information about service delivery and progress towards achieving contract or internally-set goals. Design form for receiving, processing, and/or tracking data. Develop project-specific data management plans that address areas such as data reporting, transfer, and work flow processes. Evaluate processes and technologies, and suggest revisions to increase productivity and efficiency.
Data Visualization: Develops and conducts web-based data visualization in Tableau or other visualization software for division specific programs. Creates, maintains, and updates all online technical documentation for data visualization reports. Researches all methodology approaches to displaying public health information in an online manner. Designs, develops, and presents data in various forms such as charts, graphs, tables, narratives, etc., that are used for the purposes of quality improvement, proposed legislation, budget, resource and policy planning, intervention program planning, and community education.
Performance Tracking: Tracks units of service in comparison to contract targets, deliverables, or internally-set key performance indicators.
Documentation of Procedures: Documents procedures for the entry, cleaning, and quality assurance of data in policies and procedures manuals that can be referenced by clinical and administrative staff.
Compliance: Uses understanding of compliance policies and relevant regulations to report potential compliance issues identified through the data analysis process to agency’s compliance team for further review and investigation. Ensures confidentiality and security of data, including HIPAA protected data.
Data Automation: Develops and implements procedures for the automation of data entry/manipulation whenever possible to reduce the likelihood of human error affecting the accuracy of work products.
Presentations: May contribute to presentations and communicate data to a range of audiences including the general public or non-technical staff.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a major in public health, health care administration, health informatics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field. Experience: One (1) year of professional or paraprofessional experience in public health care setting or data analysis, with responsibility for program implementation, direct service delivery, planning, or program evaluation. Experience developing data validation standards and processes for large datasets; analyzing large datasets and developing public facing data visualizations and products that were used in presentations to executive management and/or key leadership; defining, planning, and leading program evaluation efforts.
Knowledge: Data analysis; data interpretation and reporting; data governance. Statistical analysis skills. Basic knowledge of form building and data visualization.
Skills: Skills in Tableau or any other report/data visualization platform. Experience working with form building system. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Good verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and Outlook.
Abilities: Ability to work both independently, and as a team member and project leader. Critical thinking. Ability to present information to both technical and non-technical users. Manage multiple projects, as well as meet time constraints and expectations. Have a thorough understanding of public health delivery, data collection and analysis, and must have strong organizational and record keeping skills. Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Personal Relationships: Possess strong communication and facilitation skills in order to educate and coordinate varied agencies and organizations pertaining to data findings and reports. Maintain frequent contact with department supervisor, other staff, community representatives, and other governmental jurisdictions for the purpose of giving and receiving factual work-related information.
Physical Requirements: This is largely a sedentary role, with most of the duties performed on a computer and phone. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. Desk and workspaces are able to accommodate a wheelchair.
Background Check: Pass a drug screen and criminal background check.

Salary and Benefits:

Our benefits make Vanderburgh County Health Department an exceptional place to work. We offer:
Comprehensive benefits package, including: 5 vacation days after the first 6 months and 10 per year with expanded vacation after 5 years and 15 paid holidays annually; medical, dental, and vision coverage; disability insurance; life insurance.
Workforce Development including ongoing training, and promotional opportunities
Flexible work hours; 40-hour work week with very occasional weekend assignments. Full time, usual hours 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m., M–F, with lunch breaks. May be required to work occasional evenings with the ability to flex these hours.
A guaranteed pension plan after meeting pension benefit requirements, Public Employee Retirement Fund (PERF)
Opportunities for Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program for eligible workers
Commitment to diversity, inclusion, equity, and welcoming environment. Affirmative action commitment.
Employees will receive fully funded trainings and certifications throughout their onboarding process and workforce development during their employment.

Application Instructions:

Apply via INDEED
Vanderburgh County Health Department is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Vanderburgh County Health Department will take the steps to ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Vanderburgh County Health Department at 812-435-2400

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Community Healthcare System is hiring a Data Analyst – Healthcare Analytics!




Remote Position




Job Description:




This position resides in the Data Analytics and Informatics department of Community Healthcare System and is responsible for the development and maintenance of dashboards, scorecards, and reports in support of the organization’s analytic initiatives. This role works closely with hospital departments and leadership, as well as other areas of the DAI department, including the business intelligence developers, CRM, and clinical integration teams, in the implementation and roll out of analytics projects. This position will lead and perform complex analysis and assist customers in transforming data into information through logical data models that fit the customer’s needs and help the organization to make data-driven decisions. The ideal candidate will have expert level excel skills, previous experience in the development of dashboards, and the ability to bring data to life through storytelling and visual analytics.




Build dashboards and reports using Tibco Spotfire that provide insights and actionable information for business leaders
Translate business opportunities and use cases into comprehensive analytic requirements
Develop interactive visualizations using data from various data sources
Summarize raw data into meaningful, easy-to-understand information
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data
Provide ad-hoc analysis as requested by leadership
Work with customers to build relationships and gain a deeper understanding of business needs
Develop and produce various scorecards, including for both overall service lines and individual provider performance
Collect and study data to reveal ways to enhance operational efficiencies
Make recommendations about the methods a company should use to collect, analyze and manage data to improve data quality and the efficiency of data systems
Analyze and quantify impact of organizational initiatives
Validate accuracy of data



Required Skills & Qualifications:




Bachelor’s Degree required in related field, preferably in Analytics.
Demonstrated data analysis experience including but not limited to data extraction, data manipulation, data querying/reporting, data visualization, etc.
Possesses advanced analytical, detailed oriented, technical, and problem-solving skills.
Experience using a data visualization tool, i.e Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, or similar preferred.
Previous experience in healthcare preferred ideally in a health system.
Expertise in MS Excel (pivot tables, formulas, data models, macros) and PowerPoint; intermediate to advanced proficiency using other MS Office applications.
Experience with analytical applications such as Crystal Reports and SAS are a plus; must be able to develop simple graphs and charts to explain how the analysis will influence the business.
Possess exceptional verbal and written communication in order to explain results of statistical findings in layman terms a business customer will understand.
Excellent organizational and project management skills in order to work independently and multi-task in a fast-paced environment meeting deadlines.

Job Title: Data Analyst - Customer and GTM Data Projects
Job Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Data

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Description:
Trusted business data is the foundation for Salesforce to know our customers, meet our business goals, and innovate with intelligence and AI capabilities. This role will support our Customer & Go-to-Market Data Projects team on a multi-year journey to transform our business user experience in our core Salesforce instance. The Data Analyst will understand the business processes and underlying data that impact our user experience, operational efficiency, and ability to fuel insights and AI. The Business Data Analyst will participate in cross-functional requirements workshops, support solution ideation sessions, and provide data analyses to frame recommendations to improve our data quality for the Account and Contact workstream, and participate in user acceptance and data validation testing.

This role must understand the impact and value of data and metadata quality across the business. This individual must excel in data analysis and problem-solving, and have the ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate their findings. They must act independently and be able to own the analysis, recommendations, and impacts of assigned projects. This person must also be able to be successful in an unstructured, geographically distributed, team-oriented environment.

Our ideal candidate will have experience working with large, complex data sets, have exceptional analytical skills, and excel in solving abstract problems. The candidate must be comfortable spending hours analyzing data sets in order to recognize trends and must enjoy finding patterns in data. The right candidate should be able to think of out-of-the-box approaches to solving business problems as no two problems are the same. The individual must demonstrate an ability to be a self-starter and be prepared to roll their sleeves up to get the job done! Our team moves fast, so the ideal candidate will know how to ask the right questions to get help and remove roadblocks.

Responsibilities:

Perform data analysis using SQL, Excel, Salesforce Reports, Einstein Analytics, Tableau, Business Objects
Investigate data problems and perform deep-dive analyses to help guide recommendations. This includes the ability to work with inputs from several cross-functional teams to be able to summarize trends and the root cause of any current state issues.
Provide best practices and support to business leaders with respect to data quality improvements and automation
Understand business processes, the flow of data within and between processes, and recommend process improvements for better data quality and effectiveness
Create documentation for multi-stakeholder alignment. Creatively manage and clear ambiguity.
Summarize complex analysis in simple story-telling slides which makes it easier for stakeholders to understand the approach.
Create UAT test plans; participate in testing; report on and propose solutions for pass/fail test cases
Participate in Data Validation testing for data migrations from one system to another
Design solutions with an automation mindset

Required skills & experience:

2+ years of data analyst experience
Advanced knowledge of Excel or similar tool
Intermediate SQL experience
Flexibility to work across multiple time zones
Knowledge of the Salesforce Sales Cloud object model

Preferred skills:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science / Business / Mathematics or similar field
The ability to analyze, model, and interpret data
Ability to multi-task while managing deadlines, ability to perform well under pressure, and ability to work independently
Ability to work across multiple teams and build relationships to understand business operational process complexities
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to proactively QA your own work to ensure quality standards and requirements are met
Ability to identify & communicate road blocks proactively
Attention to Detail: hashtag (#) your favorite Excel formula somewhere on your resume.
Salesforce Certified Administrator
Salesforce object model & SOQL experience preferred
Experience querying in an Enterprise Data Warehouse
Project Management experience

Group 1001 is a consumer-centric, technology-driven family of insurance companies on a mission to deliver outstanding value and operational performance by combining financial strength and stability with deep insurance expertise and a can-do culture. Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. This goal extends to how we hire and onboard our most valuable assets – our employees.
Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences.
Job Summary:
The Data Analyst position is responsible for the maintenance of an integrated data warehouse. The role will focus on managing the current data warehouse, assisting with ongoing daily support of production process, and maintenance of the current data model for the data warehouse, data governance standards, and data quality. The position is a hands-on role responsible for analyzing and understanding business needs to translate needs into developed requirements and approaches and facilitate the implementation of the solution, with a key focus on continued development and improvement of the data model as well as and testing and support.
Main Accountabilities:
Participates in the design of the data model for specific data subjects, analyzing the data, and developing requirements, including the initial technical design, and working with developers through implementation.
Maintains focus on designing solutions that balance system flexibility, accuracy, and fast processing time.
Implements data quality rules to ensure that all data sources are consistent and accurate.
Develops detailed prototypes to help develop requirements and to give the end-users some improvements in their process.
Works directly with business users to assist in support of the systems and solutions. Balances the timely support of the production environment with the longer-term delivery of ongoing maintenance and enhancements.
Utilizes technology tools to enhance data analysis and data presentation skills to identify issues or gaps.
Qualifications:
BA/BS with a concentration in Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related fields.
2+ years of experience in Financial Industry, with a focus on data and technology.
Strong technical background and experience with Python, MongoDB and MSSQL.
Strong analytical skills.

Job Title: IT Business Analyst

Summary of Position: The Business Analyst assists the Project Management Office in the charting, scoping, tracking, and execution of projects and requests. The Business Analyst provides consistent, high quality data analysis, troubleshooting, research and issue resolution, and leads both external and internal client projects. This position seeks to address client needs by engaging the appropriate IT resources to provide and implement solutions that align to their goals and objectives needs.

The overall goal of this position is to provide collaborative support to the Project Management Office by ensuring customer projects are appropriately scoped in terms of resources, timing, and completion requirements. The ability to track and understand resources required to achieve customer objectives is paramount. This position will partner closely with the Director of Project Management, and together, will ensure effective project management and communication is occurring at all times. An important aspect of this role is the ability to work with internal and external resources to better understand what it will take to successfully score, onboard, and ultimately deliver projects to the institution. The Business Analyst will work on Small/Medium scale projects and will be required to partner with all IT divisions to effectively serve the needs of the customer. The ability to work closely with IT Directors and support personnel to gather business requirements and ensure resources are effectively allocated and managed is critical. The Business Analyst is a member of the Project Management Office and participates in establishing its goals, strategies, and performance indicators for success.


Duties and Responsibilities

Foster effective communication between IT and external clients
Effectively scope the resources, including cost, duration, and personnel, as well as business requirements/dependencies necessary to complete a project
As needed, assist in the guidance of client projects through the portfolio prioritization process
Assist with strategic oversight to ensure IT delivers an effective solution
Follow-up complex problems using tools and resources available
Develop and execute project plans with the objective of maintaining client satisfaction
Complete projects and address issues in an accurate, timely manner
Recommend project improvements to clients related to desired outcomes
Ensure timely completion and follow-up on action items, client requests and vendor requirements
Set realistic and accurate expectations with clients on IIT’s ability to deliver on project objectives and timelines
Keep up-to-date on new trends and technology related to client projects
Make recommendations and provide insights on resources needed to complete client projects
Assist in ensuring effective project updates and communication is occurring between the Project Management Office and IT as a whole
Working with the Director of Project Management, produce and disseminate dashboards and reports to ensure the project status is visible to all clients. This includes reports on budget, timeline, milestones, and all deliverables
Act as a Project Management resource when requested
Other duties may be assigned

Valve+Meter is seeking a growth-minded Data Analyst to join our growing performance marketing agency. As a key member of our Analytics & Insights team, you’ll be tasked with using data to drive action and growth for our clients. Analytics and insights are only as strong as the underlying data that powers them, so we are looking for an expert in modeling, engineering, analyzing, and communicating data effectively.

In this role, you’ll help empower our account management and marketing operations teams by equipping them with actionable insights on campaign performance, allowing us to make data-driven decisions faster.

From our headquarters on the northside of Indianapolis, we help clients nationwide grow and scale their businesses. We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment after you’ve spent a few months working mostly in our office. For this position, we will consider relocation for the right candidate, but you’ll need to be in the office as you ramp into your new role.

Why this Role is Important

Valve+Meter’s approach to marketing involves a focus on customer acquisition. We don’t believe marketing performs until it delivers a definite, consistent flow of new business for our clients. Joining the Valve+Meter team means bringing your talent and personality to the table when brainstorming and iterating with a group of people from different backgrounds, such as business strategy, marketing, creative, data, and analytics.

You love all things data and analytics and thrive where "the rubber meets the road" in turning vision into reality. We strive to be the team that can "figure anything out" and are looking for someone with a knack for solving complex problems and an endless desire to learn.

You are at the forefront of driving growth and change, finding the right levers to pull at the right time to maximize results. You should have a passion for all things data, a propensity to problem-solve, phenomenal attention to detail, but most importantly, an endless appetite to learn.

About the Role


This role reports to the Analytics & Insights Manager

Data Management

Model, extract, and ingest data from various systems and methods, including flat files, APIs, and databases.

Create effective and efficient data pipelines and ETL flows that allow analytics to drive actionable insights.

Take business requirements and vision and transform them into effective data solutions.

Develop dashboards to communicate insights and drive action by using data to tell a story rather than simply showing charts.

Design and development of automated solutions for recurring reporting and in-depth analysis.

Perform analysis of complex data sets to verify accuracy and completeness of raw data as well as identify and interpret trends or patterns.

Business Intelligence & Insights

Analyze marketing performance on a client-by-client basis

Provide insights into campaign and marketing strategy optimization

Measure ROI and ROMS (return on marketing spend) of campaigns

Prove or disprove marketing tests using a variety of statistical methods

Develop visualizations, proactively identify trends, and effectively communicate findings and analytics insights to key stakeholders

Prepare reporting deliverables for internal and client teams.

Execute ad-hoc analytics and insights requests

Collaboration

Collaborate with account managers and marketing leaders to understand how marketing activity turns into customers. Continually refine our process to convert customers and grow our clients.

3+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence and/or data engineering, including demonstrated experience using data to create and deliver insights. Experience working in a marketing agency or revenue operations function would be an asset.

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field

Software & Technology:

Experience creating effective and efficient data pipelines and tables in a cloud environment such as GCP or AWS

Hands-on experience with a BI tool such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or Domo, Complex APIs, both REST and GraphQL

POSITION PURPOSE
The business analyst – Customer Service- will manage and interpret data to improve IndyGo's customer service, support technology projects, and assist with data-driven decision-making in the Public Affairs division. Documents customer service business processes to provide training for employees.

POSITION TITLE: Student Success Data Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Academic and Career Development

POSITION STATUS: FT (12 month)

POSITION REPORTS TO: Director of Student Success

JOB SUMMARY: The Student Success Data Analyst works collaboratively with faculty, staff, and students to ensure an accurate and holistic collection and utilization of data related to student retention, persistence, and graduation. The Student Success Data Analyst actively monitors the health of retention-related software, develops processes and training opportunities for all stakeholders to understand and utilize appropriate technology, and establishes a roadmap for software usage. Additionally, the Student Success Data Analyst monitors and triages early alerts for the campus community, directing and assigning interventions to the appropriate personnel as necessary. The Student Success Data Analyst reports on trends related to student retention and persistence, early alert submissions, and campus participation. This is a grant-funded, full-time, benefit-eligible position.  This is a non-ranked faculty position.

Duties and Responsibilities

Triages early alerts and directs student alerts to appropriate campus personnel for interventions and student success solutions.
Monitor campus-wide student progress towards graduation; extract, analyze, and report on student trends utilizing available databases and resources (e.g. Colleague, Canvas, Pharos360).
Governs updates and requests for retention case management functions and communicates alterations and updates to all impacted campus stakeholders as necessary.
Empowers faculty and staff with training opportunities for student success interventions alongside the Director of Student Success and Student Success Coaches.
Monitors functionality of retention software and implements project roadmap strategies to enhance intervention opportunities.
Reports on campus usage of retention software tools and develops strategies to increase utilization.
Works closely with the Office of Institutional Advancement, IT, and other relevant parties to ensure data health and data feed connections to ensure robust and holistic data analysis and data informed strategy development.
Document, track, prioritize, and communicate case management changes and implementations across campus.
Actively participate in Student Success Engagement and Equity Team meetings and initiatives.
Serve on cross-departmental teams for selected initiatives to further student success and engagement (e.g., Student Care Team, Council for Integrated Advising, etc.).
Continue professional development and scholarly activity in the field of academic advising to maintain knowledge of best practices and trends.
Serve on university-wide committees as needed.

Employees provide the intellect, empathy, and ability to serve our students and community. The USF Way of serving is a source of pride for many employees. To provide a consistently high level of quality experience across our university, we provide the following service expectations for all employees. These standards have been tailored by position and responsibilities and are incorporated into performance evaluations.

Respond promptly, whether in person, via phone, or email.

Standard #3: Recognize and celebrate milestones and achievements.

Standard #4: Use resources wisely and support green initiatives.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Education

Bachelor’s degree required, Master's in higher education, student personnel, educational leadership, data analysis, or similar field preferred.

Experience

Experience in higher education at the undergraduate level with evidence of success in reaching diverse groups of students required.
1-3 years usage of retention case management software solutions required; Pharos360 experience preferred.

Knowledge and Skills

Ability to multi-task and provide exemplary customer service along with a professional demeanor and a positive attitude.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Team-oriented and skilled in working within a collaborative environment.
Ability to plan, organize, and implement assigned responsibilities and to work well under pressure to meet established deadlines.

About Envita Solutions:

Envita Solutions, formerly known as Heritage Interactive Services, is a leading total waste management partner. The company is dedicated to fostering a healthier planet by transforming complex waste challenges into sustainable solutions. Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, Envita Solutions operates in the U.S., Mexico, and Canada, has over 300 employees, and a network of over 3,000 supplier partners. A division of The Heritage Group, Envita Solutions is part of a portfolio of more than 30 companies specializing in heavy construction and materials, environmental services, and specialty chemicals. With unique access to research and development and a leading hard tech corporate venture capital portfolio, Envita Solutions is at the forefront of waste and climate challenge innovation.

At Envita, our guiding principles are the foundation of our company. Our vision is to foster a healthier planet by transforming complex waste challenges into sustainable solutions. We exist to protect human health and the environment and build a safer, more sustainable world. We believe in creating enduring value, building long-term relationships and mutual trust, betting on our people, keeping our eyes open for opportunity, tackling the big problems, and doing the right thing-always.

For more information, please visit www.envitainc.com.

Data Analyst Summary

The Data Analyst will be responsible for understanding numerous data sources that contribute to the productivity of our organization. Working under the direction of the Sr. Strategic Manager of Digital Transformation, the candidate will be responsible for doing the research and putting queries together to help us better understand different perspectives on the use of our data.

In addition to providing insights, the successful candidate will be responsible for contributing to the development team writing queries as part of the agile production releases and researching results from existing queries to explain the data.

How You'll make an Impact

Learn the business' data structure to be able to craft queries across numerous data sources
Use our data effectively to provide insights for strategic business decisions
Assist in data transformation for the next generation data and process automation
Research business questions regarding existing queries and provide insights as to why data is or is not included in data sets
Write queries for standard business requests as part of the development process
Provide a sounding board for best practices or improvements for performance improvements with existing queries and stored procedures
Be a role model of best practice in the use of data in our organization
Participate in Scrum ceremonies as needed, and being a team player in working together
Look for opportunities to share experiences and ideas in order to be innovative
Effectively work with individuals across the team, including external partners to solve problems
