Job Description

GDIT is seeking a Data Systems Analyst/Architect to support the NIH Office of Management (OM) Administrative Systems Technology Officer (ASTO) in undertaking a multi-year effort to implement a large-scale data strategy and governance program. This initiative represents a foundational change in the data support model throughout the enterprise performance lifecycle (EPLC) of the numerous systems which provide decision support data to the multiple mission-critical areas of responsibility within the OM. This position is an internal and external customer-facing role that works directly with leadership, stakeholders, business management teams, and technical management teams to build relationships with stakeholders and exceed their expectations.

You will serve as a liaison between the ASTO and NIH stakeholders to modernize business systems data architecture by implementing NIH’s Digital Strategy. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to, support for project management activities, data integration requirements, system integration management, and administrative support.

Work Visa sponsorship will not be provided for this role.

HOW A DATA SYSTEMS ANALYST/ARCHITECT WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

Lever expertise in enterprise data architecture, management, and governance to lead projects and teams of internal and external stakeholders
Gather and document system design requirements, coordinate interviews for data documentation and analysis. Document ‘as is’ state of system and projected future state, including performing intersystem data mapping as needed. Present findings to stakeholders, and document processes and lessons learned
Lead the development of analytic systems approach and framework design in cooperation with internal partners
Present future design scenarios with strengths and weaknesses of each option. Score design options based on ability to fulfill stakeholder requirements within the technical constraints of the deployment environment
Ensure the final design fits the customer requirements and is a scalable, open model that can be handed off to the customer to perpetuate once initial implementation is completed

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED


Education: MS (or equivalent experience);
Required Experience: Minimum of 8 years of experience planning and implementing IT solutions from diverse software platforms across large and diverse organizations
Required Technical Skills:
Minimum of six years with modern database architectures, such as RDBMS, NoSQL, key value
Good understanding of leading cloud platforms, including AWS, Azure, and Google
Familiarity with data governance
Minimum of four years of experience with data cataloging
Minimum of four years of experience with Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools
Familiarity with Project Management Institute (PMI) project management tools, techniques, and documentation with the ability to prescribe those into adaptable and flexible project plans
Experience with communications and customer engagement for enterprise-wide software platform applications
Experience contributing to change management and project management plans on large-scale projects
Excellent Business Case development capabilities to include risk identification and risk management
Security Clearance: Ability to acquire Level 5 Public Trust
Required Skills and Abilities:
Ability to effectively communicate and the ability to lead discussions with strong facilitation skills
Ability to exhibit professional diplomacy, while effectively relating to people at all organizational levels internally and externally
Proficiency in the use and integration of Microsoft 365 applications; specifically, Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, Planner, Lists, Forms, and PowerPoint
Experience working on multiple projects at once, balancing priorities and multitasking
Preferred Skills:
Minimum of two years of direct experience working with NIH or other federal agencies within HHS
Experience determining requirements for artifacts and records required by the HHS Enterprise Performance Lifecycle framework
Experience with IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) processes for ITSM
Agile, SAFe, or other certifications for ITSM delivery
Understanding of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technologies
Literacy with and the ability to ensure compliance with Federal requirements for accounting, record-keeping, project management, security, and other regulatory requirements
Location: Remote

GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:

401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

Job Description
What is a Sr Data Analyst / Software Developer at BAE Systems? It is an empowered role supporting the Controls & Avionics Supplier Partnerships team through collaboration on continuous improvement projects, recurring metrics, and other data and reporting needs. BAE Systems is looking for an experienced candidate with interest in data analytics and software development.

In Controls & Avionics Solutions, you will have the opportunity to help define, support, and develop the next generation of avionics - whether it is fly-by-wire flight controls, full authority digital engine controls, or power management. The qualified individual will have responsibility to support the supply chain across these business areas. Candidates will need to demonstrate technical capability and good personal skills in order to communicate effectively with internal customers, functional analytics and software teams. As part of the Controls & Avionics Supplier Partnerships team, projects and responsibilities are focused on meeting the supply chain team's strategic objectives.
We foster a diverse, inclusive, and team-oriented environment and provide opportunity for inner-team coaching and growth opportunities. We also allow a flexible work schedule.

In this opportunity, you will make impacts in the following ways:
Analyze new and existing business systems to determine proper software & data solutions
Create new, proficient applications that solve business issues
Implement modifications to existing applications to fix errors, improve performance, and upgrade interfaces
Coordinate with business and technology teams to ascertain system requirements, such as program functions, input/output requirements, data acquisition, and system controls
Work collaboratively with customers to ensure business needs are met
Create database reports supporting data analysis efficiency with team
Create dashboards to support metrics tracking and trend analysis
To be successful in this role, the selected individual will need extensive knowledge of programming languages and the software development life-cycle.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills

Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or technical equivalent. (i.e. Information Systems, Information Management, Informatics, or Similar)
Experience working with SQL and procedural SQL (PL/SQL, T-SQL, etc)
Experience with all aspects of relational database design
Proficiency in web design (HTML, CSS, jQuery, AJAX, Javascript)
Experience managing large data sets
Experience creating data visualizations (Power BI, SSRS, or similar tools)
Must excel at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills

Certifications in Oracle DB SQL, Microsoft SQL Server
Other applicable IT certifications
Familiarity with SPC Analysis
Proficiency in scripting and compiled languages (Java, Python, VB.net, VBA, Powershell, BASH, batch scripts, etc)
Experience with Microsoft Server, UNIX/LINUX, Solaris
Experience with database administration
Experience with developing APEX, Tableau, and Midas applications
Experience with git version control and related services (ie.Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket)

Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $73350 - $124740

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Electronic Systems
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

Job Title: Data Analyst II - Health First Indiana Position
Job Description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION

COUNTY OF VANDERBURGH, INDIANA

POSITION: Data Analyst 2 (116121) HFI

JOB CATEGORY: VCHD 10

DEPARTMENT: Vanderburgh County Health Department - Administration

SUPERVISOR: Supervisor of Data

DATE WRITTEN: 1990 DATE REVISED: July 2023

Summary:

The Vanderburgh County Health Department’s mission is to build a healthier Vanderburgh County so everyone in Vanderburgh County can live their healthiest life. Vanderburgh County Health Department is offering an outstanding opportunity as a Public Health Data Analyst I.Come join our dedicated and mission-driven team, and you will enjoy excellent benefits and work/life programs, a superior retirement package, and the chance to see how your work directly improves the health of your community. The Vanderburgh County Health Department has achieved Public Health Accreditation Board (PHAB) accreditation, distinguishing it as a top health department, and prides itself on providing a diverse and inclusive work environment with opportunities to grow and develop professionally. Be part of a team that exists to serve our clients and community by working with community partners to develop and provide quality health care services, promote healthy lifestyles, protect against and prevent the spread of disease, and assure preparedness to achieve and maintain the best public health for our community.

Location:

Vanderburgh County Health Department with potential travel to surrounding counties

Definition:

The Public Health Data Analyst II will help collect, analyze, query, report, and visualize data from a variety of different domains, and use the data to improve the health of the community. The Public Health Data Analyst II will conduct full lifecycle analyses to include requirements, activities and design along with monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify opportunities for improvement that align with Vanderburgh County Health Department’s mission and vision. The Public Health Data Analysist II will ensure public knowledge of important services and topics are readily available by monitoring and updating the Vanderburgh County Health Department website and social media pages as deemed appropriate.

Duties:

Data Quality: Ensures datasets are accurate and clean by doing initial scrubbing of data and regular scheduled examination of records. Tracks and reports progress on data cleaning goals. Formulates techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy, and legitimacy of data. Acquires data from primary and secondary sources including other Vanderburgh County Health Department divisions and employees, community partners, and Indiana Department of Health contacts in order to maintain databases/data systems. Deviation from the normal operating methods are discussed with supervisor and Health Department leadership as needed. Maintains data quality through ongoing data analysis, case detail and sub-details, and record deduplication. Implements process improvements that contribute to improved data quality. Plans the development, mining, and modification of data from multiple sources, ensuring compliance with policies and procedures for agency, state, and federal programs. Holds administrative responsibility and oversight of data systems, reporting and information systems, and other third-party systems as assigned.
Data/Statistical Analysis: Extracts clean data from systems of record. Reviews, analyzes, and finalizes data that must be provided for reports in accordance with federal guidance and relevant detail sheets indicating definition and data source. Analyzes specific data sets and works closely with data stewards to ensure accuracy and completeness of data; follows up with data stewards and/or internal or external partners including vendors to correct or complete data. Identifies, analyzes, interprets, summarizes, and documents trends or patterns within the data sets and develops recommendations for program improvements and/or new initiatives. Develop programs for providing more effective public health initiatives, as well as resolve current service issues. Completes necessary trainings to increase skill in manipulating and formatting data in a way that is readily consumed. Read technical literature and participate in continuing education or professional association to maintain awareness of current database technology and best practices. Identifies other data needed to effectively evaluate activities and progress related to the action plan priorities, objectives, and measures. Generates data queries based on validation checks or errors and omissions identified during data entry to resolve identified problems. Performs qualitative and/or quantitative analysis, develops and analyzes statistical information.
Reporting: Maintains and refines reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity. Works with management to identify new and creative opportunities to leverage shared data to support additional program improvement processes or functions. Completes necessary trainings to manipulate and format data as needed. Develops initial drafts of each report per specifications; provides drafts to leadership team for review and input prior to delivery; incorporates feedback received including modifications to processes and procedures. Develops analytic and reporting requirements from grant details and leadership team. Reports performance to internal partners. Creates tools to provide internal leadership with real-time information about service delivery and progress towards achieving contract or internally-set goals. Design form for receiving, processing, and/or tracking data. Develop project-specific data management plans that address areas such as data reporting, transfer, and work flow processes. Evaluate processes and technologies, and suggest revisions to increase productivity and efficiency. Meets with division leadership to ensure accurate information, resources, and data are available to clients and the public on the Vanderburgh County Health Department website and social media.
Community Involvement: Collaborate with community partners and local officials in an effort to disseminate the message and services provided by the Vanderburgh County Health Department along with the progress accomplished by various implemented programs. Work in partnership with local radio, TV, and media crafting the Vanderburgh County Health Department’s message on services and programs rendered and use these avenues to report progress on initiatives and health status changes.
Data Visualization: Develops and conducts web-based data visualization in Tableau or other visualization software for division specific programs. Creates, maintains, and updates all online technical documentation for data visualization reports. Researches all methodology approaches to displaying public health information in an online manner. Designs, develops, and presents data in various forms such as charts, graphs, tables, narratives, etc., that are used for the purposes of quality improvement, proposed legislation, budget, resource and policy planning, intervention program planning, and community education.
Performance Tracking: Tracks units of service in comparison to contract targets, deliverables, or internally-set key performance indicators.

Documentation of Procedures: Documents procedures for the entry, cleaning, and quality assurance of data in policies and procedures manuals that can be referenced by clinical and administrative staff.

Compliance: Uses understanding of compliance policies and relevant regulations to report potential compliance issues identified through the data analysis process to agency’s compliance team for further review and investigation. Ensures confidentiality and security of data, including HIPAA protected data.

Data Automation: Develops and implements procedures for the automation of data entry/manipulation whenever possible to reduce the likelihood of human error affecting the accuracy of work products.

Advising: May train other staff on Tableau or other software. May contribute to formulation of research questions.

Presentations: May contribute to presentations and communicate data to a range of audiences including the general public or non-technical staff.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a major in public health, health care administration, health informatics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field. Experience: Three (3) years of professional or paraprofessional experience in public health care setting or data analysis, with responsibility for program implementation, direct service delivery, planning, or program evaluation. At least one (1) year of: developing data validation standards and processes for large datasets; analyzing large datasets and developing public facing data visualizations and products that were used in presentations to executive management and/or key leadership; defining, planning, and leading program evaluation efforts; maintaining website and social media pages.
Knowledge: Data analysis; data interpretation and reporting; data governance. Statistical analysis skills. Basic knowledge of form building and data visualization. Basic knowledge and understanding of WordPress.
Skills: Skills in Tableau or any other report/data visualization platform. Experience working with form building system. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Good verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and Outlook.
Abilities: Ability to work both independently, and as a team member and project leader. Critical thinking. Ability to present information to both technical and non-technical users. Manage multiple projects, as well as meet time constraints and expectations. Have a thorough understanding of public health delivery, data collection and analysis, and must have strong organizational and record keeping skills. Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Personal Relationships: Possess strong communication and facilitation skills in order to educate and coordinate varied agencies and organizations pertaining to data findings and reports. Maintain frequent contact with department supervisor, other staff, community representatives, and other governmental jurisdictions for the purpose of giving and receiving factual work-related information.
Physical Requirements: This is largely a sedentary role, with most of the duties performed on a computer and phone. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. Desk and workspaces are able to accommodate a wheelchair.
Background Check: Pass a drug screen and criminal background check.

Salary and Benefits:

Our benefits make Vanderburgh County Health Department an exceptional place to work. We offer:
Comprehensive benefits package, including: 5 vacation days after the first 6 months and 10 per year with expanded vacation after 5 years and 15 paid holidays annually; medical, dental, and vision coverage; disability insurance; life insurance.
Workforce Development including ongoing training, and promotional opportunities
Flexible work hours; 40-hour work week with very occasional weekend assignments. Full time, usual hours 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m., M–F, with lunch breaks. May be required to work occasional evenings with the ability to flex these hours.
A guaranteed pension plan after meeting pension benefit requirements, Public Employee Retirement Fund (PERF)
Opportunities for Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program for eligible workers
Commitment to diversity, inclusion, equity, and welcoming environment. Affirmative action commitment.
Employees will receive fully funded trainings and certifications throughout their onboarding process and workforce development during their employment.

Application Instructions:

Apply via INDEED
Vanderburgh County Health Department is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Vanderburgh County Health Department will take the steps to ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Vanderburgh County Health Department at 812-435-2400

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $52,601.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid holidays
Paid sick time
Paid time off
Parental leave
Vision insurance

Experience level:

3 years

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

The Senior Data Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting the leaders of Heartland’s Operations teams with business process improvement, data analysis, and developing business intelligence (BI) tools. The Senior Data Analyst will work to gather, analyze, and translate data that has been collected regarding Heartland’s initiatives and production into a format to enable better business decisions.

Primary Responsibilities/Objectives:

Coordinate with leadership team to identify critical data to capture and report on

Consolidate and summarize data for business decision making and continuous improvements

Create graphical representations of data/analysis for easy consumption

Perform statistical analysis (correlation, regression, or time series analysis)

Inspect and cleanse data for accuracy and quality

Some data ETL/ELT responsibilities as needed

Other responsibilities as assigned

Core Competencies:

Strong understanding of reporting requirements and structural hierarchies for reporting in a collaborative environment. Query, analyze and transform complex data sets to optimize dashboard flexibility and performance.

Rationalize and identify use cases for developing data visualization, including identifying different personas for each use case.

The Senior Data Analyst will work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. The candidate will need to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions. One needs to be strong in logic and mathematics.

Communication Skills: Senior Data Analyst will be expected to present their findings or translate the data into an understandable document. This candidate will need to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas. Needs to possess the ability to work in a team environment as well as individually.

Critical Thinking: Senior Data Analyst must look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to conclusions based on the findings.

Presentation Skills: Ability to organize data and supporting information into visual representations that allow consumers to easily dissect and make decisions based on data provided.

Attention to Detail: Data is precise. Data analysts have to make sure they are vigilant in their analysis to come to correct conclusions. Must make every effort not to only meet but also preempt customer needs.

Strong experience with hands-on building and deploying Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI or Spotfire data visualizations and dashboards

Strong understanding of data visualization concepts. Thoughtfully connects these concept business metrics and KPIs to achieve business goals.

Experience in relational database concepts with a solid knowledge of SQL Server

Google Suite Products: Advanced level with Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Google Docs

Education/Experience:

Position requires knowledge typically associated with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Economics, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, related technical field, or equivalent work experience.

6+ years of applicable experience as a Data Analyst or similar role

Advanced Tableau experience building robust dashboards

Understanding of the Bankcard Industry or Commission Based Sales is a plus.



Preferred Qualities:

Motivated self-starter

Detail oriented

Cautious

Consistent

Tenacious

Ability to manage a project



Heartland Qualities:

Uncompromising honesty

Approachable and willing to offer helpful solutions

Ability to search relentlessly for better solutions

Must handle constructive feedback well

Summary

As a Claims Healthcare Business Analyst at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Your role in our mission

Gainwell empowers you show you’re a pro and help clients deliver better health and human services outcomes using innovative technology and solutions.

Analyze, plan, design, document and make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technological aspirations and ensure that items are prepared for client meetings.
Be a supportive bridge between clients, project managers and technical personnel to define, track and communicate business requirements and their expected impact by building basic conceptual data and process models
Create, execute or analyze basic test scenarios to verify that client requirements are built into system design. Work with the client on change requests, publications and claim adjustments/reprocessing
Ensure that “intent of change” is carried out through every project phase by participating in technical reviews and inspections.
Assist with quarterly and annual CPT, HCPCS and diagnosis code updates in the system, ensuring rules are correct and working on edit and audit configuration. Certified coder is a plus..
What we're looking for
Five or more years of healthcare claims experience.
Must work collaboratively in a team environment in making changes to the reference system for CPT, HCPCS and ICD-10 coding updates and benefit plan coverage.
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel and other software for conducting quantitative analysis
Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills
Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
An influencer and team player who that motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way
What you should expect in this role
Fully remote opportunity from most US locations
Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation.

Group 1001 is a consumer-centric, technology-driven family of insurance companies on a mission to deliver outstanding value and operational performance by combining financial strength and stability with deep insurance expertise and a can-do culture. Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. This goal extends to how we hire and onboard our most valuable assets – our employees.
Company Overview:
Axia Technology Partners (AxiaTP) empowers organizations in all industries to achieve operational excellence through managed IT services, unified communications and custom software solutions. AxiaTP was founded in 2008. Now a member of the Group 1001 family of companies, our team is a fast-growing Complete Technology Provider.
Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences.
AxiaTP
Founded in 2008, AxiaTP started as a small telecommunications company in Indianapolis. More than a decade later, we’ve grown into a Complete Technology Provider, ready to bring value to businesses of all sizes with innovative IT solutions. Our team has more than 30 years of combined experience in helping businesses small and large across various industries. AxiaTP is a member of Group1001, whose team combines fresh thinking and a can-do culture with insurance, technology, and investment management expertise to make a real difference in people’s lives. Here, we take a human approach to technology.
What does that mean? Simply put, technology doesn’t have to be hard! Our team of experts aren’t here to overwhelm you with technical jargon; we’re here to make IT easy, and make it work for you.
Responsibilities:
As an AxiaTP Business Analyst you are responsible for bridging the gap - between development and the business - to enable change through defining business needs and collaboratively recommending solutions that deliver value to AxiaTP clients. This is accomplished by:
Working collaboratively with the client’s business team to assess business processes and elicit business requirements
Identifying and documenting needed business process improvements and functional requirements
Partnering with AxiaTP’s development team to design solution recommendations to deliver business process improvements
Supporting solution implementation and user acceptance testing
Maintaining open communication with AxiaTP and client project management
A business analyst will evaluate and document the business need and, to some degree, design a solution without diving too deep into its technical components. Documenting those business needs through use of Azure Dev Ops User Stories to communicate those business needs throughout the software development lifecycle.
Key Competencies:
Throughout our engagements, AxiaTP’s clients expect high quality interactions and results from our Business Analysts in these key competency areas:
Analytical thinking and problem solving, including creative thinking, decision making, systems thinking, conceptual thinking, visual thinking
Knowledge, including Business acumen, industry, organizational, methodology
Communication Skills, including verbal, non-verbal, written, active listening
Interaction Skills, including teamwork, facilitation, leadership and influence, negotiation, conflict resolution, teaching
Software and Tools, including Microsoft Office suite, MS Visio, BPM Notation preferred, SharePoint, Azure Dev Ops
Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years of significant experience in software implementation.
Strong consideration will be given to candidates with a background in third party development or consulting
Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from an accredited college/university
Strong consideration will be given to candidates with a background and/or experience in computer science, finance, accounting, information technology, or business administration.
The ideal candidate should have an enthusiasm for team collaboration a passion for using technology to solve problems and fulfill business outcomes
Must demonstrate ability to promote an inclusive environment that reflects the broad diversity and backgrounds represented by our Clients and Team Members and which every individual feels respected and valued
Confident in making decisions, accurate, detailed-oriented and able to problem solve/analyze
Commitment to quality and attention to detail
Ability to effectively deliver in a highly collaborative and matrixed environment
Excellent communication skills to include internal/external interaction, and documentation (samples of nonproprietary documentation maybe be asked for review)
Experience working in SDLC/Agile environments
Proven ability to proactively self-manage and complete project deliverables, with a sense of ownership
Willingness to learn new functions and technologies
Base Expectations:
AxiaTP’s Business Analysts are one of the key contacts for our clients and in all interactions are expected to demonstrate the following behavioral characteristics:
Professional behavior
Ethics
Personal accountability
Trustworthiness
Adaptability
Excellent organization and time management

We are seeking a skilled Operations Analyst Markle Indiana plant operations team. The primary focus of this role is to generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness. Must be a LOCAL applicant.

The Operations Analyst will play a vital role in providing meaningful insights to the business, utilizing data modeling and visualization techniques to communicate the story. This role is responsible for analyzing and evaluating various aspects of the sort, including inventory control, order fulfillment, labor utilization, and overall process improvement.

The Operations Analyst uses data-driven insights to identify opportunities for optimization, implement solutions, and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the sort environment.

Essential Functions:

· Generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business performance: Develop and maintain a comprehensive set of KPIs to measure operational effectiveness and efficiency in the sort environment.

· Provide meaningful insights: Collect and analyze data related to sort operations, including inventory levels, order volumes, picking and packing efficiency, and labor utilization. Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement based on data analysis, and provide regular updates and insights to business stakeholders

· Process Evaluation: Evaluate existing sorting processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas of improvement. Conduct time and motion studies, analyze order processing workflows, process mapping, and root cause analysis to identify opportunities for optimization. Identify opportunities to improve processing time, improve sort accuracy, and enhance stakeholder satisfaction.

· ERP systems: Leverage expertise in ERP systems to extract and analyze data, identifying trends and areas for optimization.

· Reporting and Communication: Prepare regular reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations to management and stakeholders. Present findings, progress, and improvement initiatives in meetings.

· Data modeling and visualization: Utilize data modeling techniques and advanced Excel skills to create models, charts, and graphs that effectively communicate complex data sets to business stakeholders.

· Training and Support: Provide training and support to plant staff on process changes, system updates, and best practices. Ensure that team members understand and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safety guidelines.

· Data integrity maintenance: Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing quality control measures and data validation techniques.

· Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with various teams such as operations, engineering, management and stakeholders to gather data, understand requirements, and develop solutions for operational challenges.

· Profit-minded approach: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency improvements through data analysis and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to implement appropriate measures. Apply a profit-minded mindset to all analyses and decision-making, focusing on improving financial performance and contributing to overall business profitability.

Skills and Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in operations management, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field; applicable experience in lieu of degree.

· Proven experience as an Operations Analyst or in a similar analytical role.

· Prior experience in a data driven environment is preferred.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

· Proficiency in data analysis tools, techniques, and software, including advanced Excel functions and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

· Familiarity with ERP systems and their data structures.

· Flexibility and initiative related to completing tasks.

· Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.

· Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.

· Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

· Continuous learning mindset to stay updated with industry trends and emerging analytics techniques.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

Department



ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT (IN-ENRL-IUINA)

Department Information



Optimizing our enrollment mix is crucial to the long-term viability of IU Indianapolis. There are several factors that influence a student's college choice, persistence, graduation and success. The Division of Enrollment Management is comprised of over 100 full-time staff in the Office of Undergraduate Admissions, Office of Student Financial Services, Office of the Registrar, Office for Veterans and Military personnel, and Office for Enrollment Strategy and Insights, as well as other areas supporting student enrollment. The Division also oversees and provides insight for its enrollment operations for the Fort Wayne and Columbus campuses.

The Division is looking for individuals who value and embrace innovation, change and entrepreneurial mindsets and approaches in advancing the mission of IU Indianapolis.

We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of age, gender, gender identity, sex, race, religion, color, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, national origin, or any other legally protected category.

For information about the department, please visit: Division of Enrollment at IUPUI.

Job Summary



Department-Specific Responsibilities

Serves the mission and directives of IUPUI by working collaboratively within the Office of Undergraduate Admissions with the Division of Enrollment Management offices and campus academic schools to achieve student recruitment, outreach, admissions, and enrollment objectives.
Provides project expertise in implementing student communication strategies, building and maintaining admission reports, translating business requirements into solutions with functional CRM configuration based on knowledge of business processes, various university student systems, and their relationship to CRM tools.
Defines, develops, maintains, and loads data from external and internal sources into our CRM systems. Structures and submits data to and from outside entities, conforming to unique specifications and requirements.
Designs, implements, and aids with the conceptualization and construction of communication campaigns, event campaigns, admissions reporting, and recruitment strategies (translating functional needs into appropriate systems). Provides instructions and guidance to staff, plans work, provides feedback and establishes timelines for team projects.
Manages reviews of system features with functional staff and provide recommendations for improvements.
Coordinates CRM training, documentation, reporting, communication, and support efforts for the office.
Develops standards and business practices to best utilize the CRM system and program features including consistent data collection and management.
Consults and collaborates jointly with the Operations and Student Experience Teams, within the Office of Undergraduate Admissions, to provide project expertise in implementing student communication strategies in support of the campus mission and objectives related to student recruitment and initial enrollment.
Develops standards and best practices in implementation of communication strategies using key enterprise and local systems developed to automate and customize communications.
Acquires and maintains knowledge of numerous related students' systems (SIS, workflow, etc.).
Develops campaigns and reports for campus events and recruitment outreach initiatives; implement standards for data entry across all platforms.
Provides analysis of existing data and data structures that satisfies ad-hoc reporting/analysis requests.
Designs and implements an assessment plan to gauge success of the student communication strategies; gather and analyze system campaigns and constituent feedback to provide recommendations for improvement.
Creates reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards/analytical tools and assists in testing/validation.
Defines, develops, maintains, and loads data from external and internal sources into our Constituent Relationship Management (CRM) systems, Translates plain-language requests into CRM reports. Structures and submits data to and from outside entities, conforming to unique specifications and requirements.
Coordinates office training, documentation, communication, reporting, and support efforts with emphasis on communication content, timing, assessment, and improvement; serves as resource on functional questions from Enrollment Management offices. Also include the role of campaign manager, executing planned communications with prospective and admitted students across student types. Documents data analysis efforts (data sources, reporting specifications, tools, issue/problem resolution).
Works collaboratively with other CRM system users across the Division of Enrollment Management and university to ensure completeness and integrity of the system data.
Contributes to the continuous design and development of new and emerging communication initiatives for constituent offices.
Creates step-by-step process testing scripts and perform detailed functional system testing, assist in resolution of issues, present final test results, and obtain agreement and approval of system features and upgrades.
Performs other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

General Responsibilities

Conducts experienced assessments to understand client business needs and strategic direction and identifies technology solutions to achieve goals; consults with IT staff and business users to identify, analyze, refine and document business requirements and processes and develop associated solutions.
Facilitates and leads interviews, focus groups, and workshops to establish current and future business requirements; coordinates the communication between stakeholders and service owners in order to effectively implement solutions.
Performs experienced business analyses, including construction of data models, business use cases, process flows and technical specifications for transition to IT solutions; establishes system requirements through functional and technical assessments of existing software.
Provides stakeholders with necessary analysis documentation for buy-in, leadership decision, and implementation; conducts walk-throughs of recommended system functionality and prototypes with business users in small group or large group settings.
Ensures uniform documentation presentation and content structure including, but not limited to, online documentation.
Develops test plans and conducts system/integration testing; can test changes, enhancements, and new programs or functions to ensure they meet business needs.
Qualifications



Combinations of related education and experience may be considered. Education beyond the minimum required may be substituted for work experience. Work experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted for education.


EDUCATION

Required

Bachelor's degree.

WORK EXPERIENCE

Required

2 years of business analysis experience working on complex problems and producing concrete, actionable solutions.

Preferred

Experience in student services, admissions, higher education, marketing or related CRM.
Experience working with enrollment management environments or other complex electronic data applications.

SKILLS

Required

Proficient communication skills.
Maintains a high degree of professionalism.
Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills.
Demonstrates a high commitment to quality.
Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty.
Highly thorough and dependable.
Demonstrates a high level of accuracy, even under pressure.
Service-oriented and skilled in providing positive, friendly customer service.

Preferred

Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze the business processes and systems to identify and resolve problems, recommend solutions, or modifications.
Ability to ensure data integrity and the quality delivered.
Proficient collaboration and consulting skills.
Strong listening skills.
Ability to communicate in complex environments and handle multiple complex tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to self-monitor quality control and accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively with front-facing colleagues.
Proficient with Salesforce CRM solutions.

Working Conditions / Demands



This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. Ability to sit for long periods of time at a computer workstation. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation.

Equipment utilized: Standard PC workstation; laptop; iPad; general office equipment (phone, copier, fax, scanner).

Additional Information



Level of Decision Making

Position requires individual to function as a team member and a consultant to departmental and campus clients on new and innovative applications of custom and vended software in the implementation of a successful communication strategy. Individual must understand various student system interrelationships & data and work with a variety of constituents across the campus to implement and experiment with new & alternative ways to leverage the CRM, and appropriately apply that knowledge to each academic or enrollment management setting. Must be confident in taking the lead and guiding others to think broadly and creatively in using new and innovative methods of communication as part of the campus strategic plan.
While some standardization is to be expected in the use of a vended system, this position is expected to listen and assess user need and translate that need successfully into the system and social media activities. This individual is expected to work independently and monitor accuracy, consistency, timing, success without direction.
Develop a compelling, focused, well-timed communication strategy for campus units and then molding those individual plans into a comprehensive campus strategy is no small task. Many of these communication channels reach large numbers of individuals electronically so this individual must have an excellent sense of the impact of his/her actions on those receiving the message as well as the units represented. This individual must also have a calm demeanor to recover in the face of problems or issues that may arise.

Scope and Impact

This position is responsible for the daily administration and articulation of campus-wide software applications in support of IUPUI's recruitment communication strategies. The CRM application has the potential to significantly influence decisions made by students with respect to enrolling at IUPUI. As such, this individual must always work with respect and understanding of the scope and impact of their actions which could lead to thousands of communications on behalf of departments or schools on campus. This individual must be able to measure the appropriate application and impact of social media tools and techniques as well. Failure to follow established business practices in generating communications campaigns could result in large numbers of students receiving the wrong communications and negatively impact their decision to enroll at IUPUI.



Work Location



IUPUI Campus Center

Indianapolis, Indiana

The Purpose of the Business Analyst is to work closely with the Product Manager, Quality Assurance, Software Architects, and Development teams to produce quality software that meets our client needs. The Business Analyst will manage the requirements process and will serve as the liaison between the Product Manager and the Technology teams. You will be responsible to identify, assess, and document business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs. Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Analyze impact of proposed solution across the business, develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to team, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews. Assist quality assurance team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed. Facilitate implementation of new functionality through training sessions, demos, and the development of appropriate documentation. Provide relevant test scenarios for the quality assurance team. Work with quality assurance team to develop system integration test scripts and ensure the testing results correspond to the business expectations.

Essential Functions

Lead functional design portion of SDLC process including: Leading functional design meetings, writing design documents, coordinating the review process.
Act as Liaison between business and technology teams in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements,
Constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications; use cases and scenarios
Hold responsibility for troubleshooting and filtering product development issues including bugs, configuration and documentation discrepancies.
Maintain communication channels with clients during collaborative development efforts.
Review feature 'Ideas' from internal and external sources then escalate those features internally, for future development.
Work across product teams to develop features and solutions to increase efficiency and productivity for our financial institution clients
Work closely across departments & with customers to build system features that impact daily financial institution operations.
Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Provide support to clients as necessary
Provide support to internal teams as necessary
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
Review Production Documentation for accuracy
Review test cases for accuracy
Communicate with other departments to coordinate test and deployment activities

Requirements

BA or BS Business, Management, Computer Science, or other related degrees
3+ years Experience Business Analyst
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Bank commercial loan systems
Ability to assimilate, organize and summarize large amounts of information
Strong knowledge of Business Analysis techniques and processes
Strong negotiation skills with ability to find successful resolutions to complex issues
Proactive with a strong sense of accountability
Ability to work both independently and as part of a close team depending upon project
Highly motivated and self-directed
Strong analytical skills and writing skills, to include solid experience in writing functional and technical specifications
Proven ability to work closely with the business and translate business needs into functional specifications for technology.
Excellent problem solving skills
Advanced skill level in SDLC processes using both waterfall & agile methodologies.
Strong ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work efforts in a demanding high paced environment.

Looking for a career with purpose and reward? At LoanCare we help customers every day with what is for many their largest and most personal financial transaction: the purchase of their home. With the mission to simplify the complex with empathy and insight, we are constantly innovating and are a top provider in the mortgage services industry as a result.

We are actively seeking to fill the role of Transfer Data Analyst III. Our ideal candidate enjoys working with clients, both internal and external, eager to learn and maximize results, is detail oriented and driven to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Background in the mortgage or real estate industry is a plus. If this sounds like you, and you are ready for a career and not just your next job, apply today!


Responsibilities:
Facilitate servicing transfer data conversions from external parties to LoanCare, including data mapping, trial events, testing and final transfer activities
Lead data mapping activities for assigned servicing transfers to in-house loan boarding application, including coordination with client, current servicer and LoanCare subject matter experts to ensure efficient and accurate loan boarding
Maintain open items from data mapping and testing processes and ensure all are resolved priorto Go/No Go decision
Act as primary point of contact for clients and current servicers (or other 3rd parties) regarding data transfer
Complete final transfer testing and balancing, issue balancing letter and facilitate loan boarding
Facilitate meetings, coordinating with clients and servicers, ensuring tasks are completed
Collaborate with Transaction Project Manager for completion of tasks with Project Plan
Work with clients and servicers to update and modify data files and/or data corrections prior to final loan boarding to ensure data integrity
Communicate with supervisor, clients, and servicers to ensure best practices are followed and issues are communicated and resolved promptly
Lead enhancements and process improvements to the loan boarding application (LoanshpereLoanboarding (LLB))
Maintain and improve knowledge of LoanCare mortgage products, line of business requirements and related field content/definitions in the servicing platform to facilitate servicing transfers effectively
Perform pre and post transfer testing utilizing exception reports from LLB and those received from the current servicer
Cross-train on and perform other functions as directed by supervisor
Primary analyst on transfers lead by Black Knight’s Acquisition Services team
Ensure data delivery guidelines are set and clearly communicated to client and current servicer
Ensure exception reports, ad-hoc reports, and scrub reports are reviewed daily for assigned transfers
Assist leadership in training department staff
Coordinate with the Lines of Business within LoanCare on changes that impact data mapping/data transfers
Participate in the development and maintenance of Servicing Transfer Instructions
Lead Department projects and serve as SME for corporate initiatives
All other duties as assigned.

About remote employment

LoanCare provides virtual training and support so employees working from home can be successful. You will never be alone on your journey as you will connect through Teams video chat, so that you remain engaged and form relationships with your leadership team and coworkers. We offer online/remote training, which is both dynamic and interactive, so you get the most out of the training opportunities. Our Training department also offers a large number of free on-demand online training courses that you can take to help you grow and expand your skills and knowledge.

As an added benefit for remote employees, we offer exciting engagement opportunities, such as fitness classes, contests, and fun seminars/learning activities that you can participate in from the comfort of your own home.

We provide all of the necessary equipment; all you need to provide is a quiet, private place in your home and a high-speed internet connection with a minimum network download speed of 25 megabits per second (mbps) and a minimum network upload speed of 10 mbps. Remote employees will be required to sign a Telecommuting Agreement in addition to the job description.

Who We Are
LoanCare is a top national provider in mortgage loan subservicing. The Company has been servicing loans for over 30 years and are known for superior customer support and digital innovation. Over $300 billion in asset value is managed by the team. LoanCare is part of Fidelity National Financial (NYSE: FNF), a leading provider of title insurance and transaction services to the real estate and mortgage industries.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Basic job duties an employee must be able to perform with, or without, reasonable accommodation.
Critical Thinking — Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Reading Comprehension — Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
English Language — Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
Speaking — Talking to others to convey information effectively.
Active Learning — Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Active Listening — Giving full attention to what other people is saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Instructing — Teaching others how to do something.
Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
Time Management — Managing one's own time and the time of others.
Writing — Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.
Complex Problem Solving — Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
Problem Sensitivity — The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
Inductive Reasoning — The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
Information Ordering — The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
Near Vision — The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).
Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
Speech Recognition — The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.
Speech Clarity — The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Position Summary:

The Senior Finance Analytics Analyst role sits within the Finance Data Office and provides enablement and analytics assistance to the Salesforce Finance team. Success in this role means that we’ve forged strong partnerships with Business Technology (BT) and our business partners in Finance to enable Finance Data Strategy driven capabilities to help Salesforce see, understand and govern our Finance data.


Collect data via a wide range of methods and curate data sources for end users. Develop and track Key Performance Indicators and metrics in order to enhance understanding of the business, to improve strategic decision making, and to improve operational efficiency. Conduct quantitative analysis, create dashboards, and take responsibility for the quality of data related to Salesforce Finance teams. Help drive and support finance data & analytics tools including strategy and administration as needed. Act as a liaison between BT and Finance on enterprise programs.

Primary Responsibilities (Essential Functions):

Build and maintain processes to extract, load, transform, and enrich data into user-friendly data sources.
Employ visual design best practices to present analyses in the form of Tableau worksheets and dashboards.
Support Alteryx Server administration tasks in collaboration with an internal admin community.
Assist in developing and delivering content through Slack updates, confluence pages, slide presentations, and live meetings.
Identify gaps and opportunities for improving existing programs and for developing new programs for all functions of the organization.
Partner with Business Technology (BT) and Finance teams to contribute towards enterprise programs.
Partner with Business Technology (BT) and Finance teams to enable self-service platforms for Finance (e.g. self-service data engineering and self-service data science).
Curate metadata, classify data, and perform other data stewardship activities to increase data accessibility.
Collaborate with teams to define and promote processes for data capture, data integrity and reporting functionality.
Develop highly effective ways of using data to influence decisions and suggest business actions.
Embody customer zero, to help Salesforce build the best products by testing and providing feedback on new and existing products.

Additional Responsibilities:

Certification: Analysts are expected to complete internal and external product certification programs within agreed upon timelines.

Knowledge & Skill Requirements:

Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the Values & Behaviors for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)
Ability to be resourceful and meet deadlines with high attention to detail.
Ability to collaborate and communicate ideas succinctly to both technical and non-technical business partners through written, visual, and verbal means of communication.
Demonstrable ability to develop programs from requirements-capture to launch, with limited guidance.
5+ years of analytical and data preparation work experience, software environment.
Advanced user of the Tableau Product Suite and Alteryx.
Good understanding of data warehouses e.g. Snowflake, Oracle required.
Accounting/Corporate finance experience helpful.
Experience with systems like NetSuite, Oracle, Workday, Concur, Coupa and Salesforce preferred.
Use of APIs, Alation, Sagemaker, and Python helpful.

Job Title: Senior HR Reporting and Data Analyst

If you are a data-driven professional with a passion for HR analytics and a desire to make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you. American Commercial Barge Line is hiring a Senior HR Reporting and Data Analyst. You play a pivotal role in shaping our HR strategy by providing data-driven insights and recommendations. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain HR reporting and analytics solutions that drive informed decision-making and support our employees' success.

When you join ACBL..

American Commercial Barge Line (ACBL) is one of the largest and most diversified marine transportation companies in the U.S. Our legacy of providing the nation with the most economical, safest, and greenest mode of transportation dates all the way back to 1915, when we began moving coal on the Kentucky River. We offer a wide range of career paths in both operations and support services. Whether you are interested in working on the river or in an office, we are always searching for the best of the best to join our ACBL team.

What you will be doing... Your IMPACT

Partner with internal stakeholders to maintain information systems, identify concerns and improve upon the quality of data, and ensure data is protected yet accessible.
Collaborate with Team Members in the analysis of data and delivery of people-friendly reporting to facilitate continuous improvement.
Develop and maintain key people-related metrics that measure the effectiveness of programs and initiatives.
Create and maintain complex reports and coach Team Members on understanding the data.
Document data definitions and data sources related to people reporting processes.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging trends in HR analytics and reporting.

What we are looking for...

You will need to have:

Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
Previous experience in Data Management or Human Resource Information Systems.
Ability to gather and interpret data, as well as improve HRIS processes.
Ability to collaborate, provide technical support, and train staff.
Ability to analyze HRIS and HR performance metrics.
Understanding of database management and security.
Ability to document processes, as well as performing diagnostic tests and audits.
Ability to keep up with technical innovation and trends in HRIS Analysis.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

Experience with UKG is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.i. Power BI, Tableau).

Overview:
At Steel Dynamics, we take pride in our intentionally sustainable approach. Sustainability is a part of our long-term value creation strategy, and we are dedicated to our people, communities, and our environment. We are committed to operating our business in an environmentally responsible manner and have been since out founding. Our sustainability and decarbonization strategy is an ongoing journey, and we are moving forward with the intention to make a positive difference.
Steel Dynamics, Inc. (SDI) is seeking a Decarbonization Accounting Analyst in Environmental Sustainability to work closely with our SDI Environmental Sustainability and Corporate Accounting teams. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing technical accounting skills, establishing and maintaining various financial and accounting systems, controls, and reporting for the rapidly growing and changing decarbonization environment. This position will have high visibility throughout the organization with all levels of management into the future as we navigate through the decarbonization transition.
This new position to SDI’s Environmental Sustainability team will be breaking ground and establishing expertise within areas that are new to the SDI organization. Therefore, this will be a truly dynamic position that will require innovative thinking and teamwork to create systems and structures that may not exist at this time.
Responsibilities:
Provide support on accounting, compliance reporting & verification audits for any/all decarbonization related projects – including SDI Biocarbon Solutions, Renewable Energy agreements, and other similar projects.
Assist in calculating and tracking costs related to Decarbonization Plans and projects.
Assist in developing an internal carbon price for use in SDI’s CEA process.
Assist in developing and tracking SDI’s overall Cost of Decarbonization, including related costs, revenues & expenses to allow for an ongoing and comprehensive view of the impacts of SDI’s financial performance.
Create and maintain verifiable sustainability / GHG accounting system for our sustainability metrics and product offerings.
Ensure SDI’s audit readiness.
Facilitate technical accounting discussions with third party experts.
Monitor SEC, other regulatory and non-regulatory activities and disclosure requirements
Tracking and assisting with governmental funding opportunities, including IIJA and IRA investment credits such as 48C
Actively participate on SDI’s Decarbonization Team, understand, drive, and support our sustainability performance, goals, and customer offerings.
Extensive interaction with all levels within SDI on a routine basis.
Serve as a conduit between Decarbonization Team and companywide controllers and accounting supervisors.
Responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of all financial and decarbonization accounting and/or reporting aspects of acquiring and retiring RTCs, RECs, and Carbon Offsets and other similar instruments.
Ensure compliance with SDI policies such as capital spending, safeguarding assets, transaction approvals and expense reimbursements.
Ensure that effective internal controls are in place, properly documented, performing as intended, reviewed regularly, and updated as needed.
Some travel will be required both inside and outside the USA.
Qualifications:
Required:
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) in active status, with at least a four-year accounting degree.
3+ years of relevant accounting and/or controllership experience.
Ability to effectively manage through ambiguity. New systems and structure will be created with this position.
Ability to analyze data and produce concise usable information.
Organizational and project management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Strong computer skills with advanced knowledge in Excel.

General Description
The Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for Department of Revenue

Job Description
The Business Systems Support Analyst will work collaboratively with staff across the agency to conduct research, gather data, define business and functional requirements, and help with data entry and implementation of projects for the Department of Revenue. This position will also play a key role in the partnership between business technical teams. The incumbents leadership, expertise and work products will establish and operate processes that ensure issues are identified, tracked, diagnosed and resolved. This individual will work to ensure that business needs and plans are successfully integrated with project delivery. The successful candidate will be positive, enthusiastic and team oriented with a passion for identifying, designing, testing, and implementing critical functionality and processes, along with proactive quality assurance. The successful BA will have a strong desire to support the Department of Revenue mission, vision, and Pyramid of Excellence to drive high-quality service delivery and continuous improvement across the agency.

Essential Job Responsibilities:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Assists in the development of technical standards and policies to meet the customers, peers, and organization;
Formulates and defines system scopes and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with a basic understanding of user needs and business systems and industry requirements:
Able to collect data, analyze it, and develop sound reporting to track, recommend and forecast enhancements to the system:
Creates process change through the integration of new processes with existing ones and communication of changes to impacted Business Systems teams;
Establishes and maintains strategic partnerships with assigned customers in order to help them meet their business and technical needs;
Participates in the development of strategic plans based on customer needs;
Analyzes business and user needs, document requirements and devises new technical business system solutions, or revises existing system logic difficulties as necessary;
Facilitates the delivery of technical business solutions and products to customers;
Manages the expectations of customers, peers, vendors, and management; Establishes contracts for the procurement of technical business solutions;

Preferred Experience:
Bachelors degree in Business or related field or equivalent experience preferred
Minimum of two years professional experience in a Business Analyst role preferred
Proficiency in meeting leadership and facilitation demonstrated by creating a fun, safe, collaborative and productive work environment
Demonstrated capacity to analyze, understand and capture business data and act on findings
Creative, disciplined and thoughtful thinker with a demonstrated ability to adjust work plans to determine the appropriate strategy and approach to success
Strong project management skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision and build credibility with business and IT leaders and varying levels of the organization
Ability to maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality
Ability to accurately and concisely present proposals and solutions to a wide audience Proficient in the use of MS Office suite of products (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, Word)

Considerable knowledge of project management theories and practices and the ability to apply that knowledge;
Ability to lead, encourage and influence others to perform;
Effectively communicate both orally and in writing;
Ability to manage diverse human resources.
